ARTICLE.TITLE: Seven cops from NE awarded Union Home Minister’s Medal for Excellence in Investigation
ARTICLE.TEXT:
GUWAHATI | AUG 13, 2020:

Seven police personnel from the Northeastern region of India have been awarded the Union Home Minister’s Medal for Excellence in Investigation for the year 2020.

The seven cops, who are among the 121 police personnel from across the country, are from Arunachal Pradesh, Meghalaya, Assam, and Tripura.

These include four from Assam and one each from Arunachal Pradesh, Meghalaya, and Tripura.

Assam:

Deputy Inspector General of Police (DIG), Devojyoti Mukherjee

Superintendent of Police, Rosei Kalita

Inspector, Rustam Raj Brahma

Sub Inspector (UB), Abhisek Bodo

Arunachal Pradesh:

Inspector, Ngilyang Lali

ALSO READ: Nagaland: NSCN cadres land in police net in two separate incidents

Meghalaya:

Women Police/Sub-Inspector, Handakarushi P Lytan

Tripura:

Sub-Inspector (UB), Dhrubajyoti Debbarma

This medal was constituted in 2018 with the objective to promote high professional standards of investigation of crime and to recognize such Excellence in an investigation by investigating officers.

ALSO READ: AASU releases MHA’s report on implementation of Clause 6 of Assam Accord released

Among the personnel receiving these awards, 15 are from the CBI, 10 each from Madhya Pradesh and Maharashtra Police, 08 are from Uttar Pradesh Police, 07 each from Kerala, and West Bengal Police, and the remaining from the other States/UT. These include twenty-one (21) women police officers.
